title: I've visualized statewise data on prevalence of underweight, wasted and stunted children under 5 years as per NFHS-5 survey
selftext:
Source: Press Information Bureau (Pib) of India
https://pib.gov.in/PressReleasePage.aspx?PRID=1806601
comments:
To download the maps or see it interactively, visit respective links:
1. https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/pkTVD/1/
2. https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/7ZQwv/1/
3. https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/eoqNt/1/
You tell me, kasa aahe tumi? Sab thik? :)
Something something Fake News something something Conspiracy against India something something Soros something something Anti national

how dare you, this is gonna push the narrative that we should give freebies to people, all those kids under 5 deserve to be malnourished , how dare you say that a MINIMUM of 12% of kids in every state are malnourished, very anti national India is a perfect country and we've abolished poverty and ambani adani etc should be getting government money and tax breaks, not FREEBIES for the poor.

Also FYI the modi government completely defunded the Integrated Child Development Services program (the primary government scheme for feeding children under the age of 5 and mothers) in 2016 and later. One of the biggest tragedies for children in our country


Â https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/
Huge-budget-cut-for-child-health-interventions/article60529622.ece
Gujju decency in protein showcased. Typical gujju looks like Jay Shah. Never won any Olympic medals but gets maximum money for sports infrastructure.

Yes right. I thought of making a composite rank map including all 3 data. It turned out Punjab did perform one of the best in the calculations of mine. But I didn't post it because I didn't find it very reliable. I had just ranked all states and then found best performing ones combining all. 

I needed more suggestions on how to combine these data if possible so we statistically make sense.
the infographic on that page you linked reports a 7% decrease. Is that what you're talking about?
It has a lot of positives, you just need to open your eyes
